subject: Law
title: The Parol Evidence Rule
description: One-minute skill: The Parol Evidence Rule.

hook.text: You signed a contract. Now you claim the seller verbally promised something extra. The court won't hear it.

buildup.text: The parol evidence rule bars prior or contemporaneous oral agreements that contradict a written contract.

discovery.text: The rationale: once parties put their deal in writing, the document should be the final word.

twist.text: Exceptions exist for fraud, mistake, ambiguity, or showing the contract isn't the complete agreement.

climax.text: Integration clausesâ€”'this is the entire agreement'â€”make it even harder to introduce outside evidence.

punchline.text: If it's not in the contract, it might as well not exist.

quiz.question: What does the parol evidence rule prevent?
options: Using prior oral agreements to contradict a written contract
